302: Hoe skakel ek na 'n lêer op MEGA?
303: Eerstens, 'n waarskuwing: die kriptografiese veiligheid van jou lêers hang af van die konfidensialiteit van jou enkripsie sleutels. Maak seker dat jy slegs deur beskermde kanale stuur. Standaard e-pos, bv, is nie genoeg nie.
304: Met dit ingedagte, kies een of veelvuldige lêers in jou lêer bestuurder, regs-druk dan en kies "kry skakel". 'n Dialoog met die openbare skakel(s) na die lêer(s) wat jy gekies het sal oopmaak. Jy kan kies om elke skakel apart uit te voer, of as 'n groep skakel.
306: Alle enkripsie is einpunt-tot-eindpunt. Data wat opgelaai is, is ge-enkripeer op die oplaai toestel voor dit opgelaai is na die internet, en data wat afgelaai is, is ge-dekripteer deur die aflaai toestel. Die kliënt masjiene is verantwoordelik vir die opwekking, uitruil en bestuur van die enkripsie sleutel. Geen bruikbare enkripsie sleutels verlaat ooit die klient se rekenaar nie (met die uitsondering van RSA openbare sleutels).
307: Is al my persoonlike inligting onderdanig aan enkripsie?
308: Nee. Slegs lêer data en lêer/gids name word ge-enkripteer. Inligting wat ons benodig vir operasionele toegang, soos jou e-pos adres, IP adres, gids struktuur, lêer eienaarskap en betaal besonderhede, word gestoor en geprosesseer sonder enkripsie. Sien asb ons Privaatheids Beleid vir besonderhede.
309: Is my gebergde data absoluut veilig?
310: Alle sekuriteit is relatief. Die volgende aanvals riglyne bestaan - hulle is nie MEGA-spesifiek nie, maar ons wil hê jy moet bewys wees van die risiko's:
312: Spyware op jou rekenaar. 'n Eenvoudige keylogger is genoeg, maar sessie besonderhede en sleutels kan ook onttrek word uit die geheue of lêer sisteem.
313: Skouer seilers. Moenie jou wagwoord insleutel terwyl iemand kan sien wat jy tik nie.
315: Phishing. Bevestig altyd die veiligheid van jou konneksie (https://) en die regte domain naam (mega.co.nz) voor jy jou wagwoord insleutel.
316: Grootskaal aanvalle kan gelanseer word deur:
317: 'n "Man in die middel" aanval. Vereis die uitreiking van 'n duplikaat SSL sertifikaat gekombineer met DNS namaaksel en/of aanvalle op ons BGP roetes ('n DigiNotar-styl situasie).
318: Deur toegang te kry tot webservers wat https://mega.co.nz/index.html hou en die lêer met 'n vervalste een te vervang (dit sal nie toegang tot die geinstalleerde app basis affekteer nie). Neem kennis dat die manipulasie van inhoud op ons verspreide statiese inhoud CDN nie 'n sekuriteits risiko inhou nie, want alle aktiewe inhoud wat opgelaai is van index.html onderworpe is aan 'n kriptografiese hash (dink aan dit as 'n tipe van  "veilige begin" vir webwerwe). Hierdie tipe aanval verg die stuur van kwaadwillige kode na die klient toe, en is daarom naspoorbaar.
319: Deur toegang te verkry tot ons serverbse infrastruktuur en nagemaakte sleutel aanvragings te skep op bestaande deelings. Hierdie tipe aanval affekteer slegs data in gedeelde gidse en is naspoorbaar aan die kliënt se kant ook.
320: Wat as ek julle nie vertrou nie? Is dit nog steeds veilig vir my om MEGA te gebruik?
321: As jy ons nie vertrou nie, kan jy geen kode gebruik wat deur ons verskaf is nie, so om ons werf oop te maak in jou browser en jou wagwoord in te sleutel is buite perke. As jy steeds MEGA wil gebruik, moet jy dit doen deur 'n kliënte app wat geskryf is deur iemand wat jy vertrou.
322: Ek vertrou jou en jou New Zealand data sentrum, maar ek vertrou nie julle Duitse data sentrum nie, want dit word deur 'n VSA maatskappy bedryf. Is dit steeds veilig vir my om  MEGA te gebruik?
323: Ja, jy kan MEGA veilig gebruik, selfs al sou ons servers in Duitsland ten volle oorgeneem word. Die New Zealandse data sentrum maak seker dat geen losloper kode kan hardloop wanneer jy https://mega.co.nz/ besoek nie.
324: Is data wat ek in gedeelde gidse sit so veilig soos my ander data?
325: Gedeelde gidse, uit nature, is slegs so veilig soos hul swakste lid. Des nieteenstaande, 'n inbraak op ons kern server infrastruktuur hou 'n addisionele risiko in: openbare sleutels kan gemanipuleer word, en sleutel aanvraag kan vervals word.
326: Kom ons neem aan die MEGA bergings eenheid is fisies oorval. Wat is die risiko's?
327: Foutboodskappe na die aflaai van veranderde lêers. Selfs al het die aanvaller die enkripsie sleutel vir 'n gegewe lêer op daardie eenheid, kan hy dit nogsteeds nie vervang met 'n vervalste een sonder om die daaropvolgende aflaaiing te laat faal nie.
328: Is dit 'n goeie idee om al my data op een plek te berg?
329: Hou altyd ongebruikte kopies van belangrike lêers, aanlyn of van lyn af. Alhoewel ons elke lêer op minstens twee plekke bewaar, is daar geen waarborg teen veelvuldige gelyktydige onderbrekings asook herhaalde ongegronde regerings wanoptrede nie.
330: Hoekom moet ek my data aan julle, van alle mense, toevertrou?
331: Ons maak voorsiening vir verbruikers beheerde enkripsie (UCE) waar jy, die verbruiker, die sleutels beheer. Die UCE implementering is oop bron, en ons nooi die publiek uit en raai hulle aan om dit te ondersoek en terugvoer te gee. Ons glomdat hierdie benadering baie veiliger is as om jou data te berg by 'n verskaffer met enkripsie aan die server se kant waar die diensverskaffer die sleutels beheer, of nog erger, geen enkripsie. Wanneer MEGA verbruikers lêers bv skielik toeganklik raak agv 'n programmerings fout, sal die lêers onbruikbaar wees sonder die dekripsie sleutels.
332: Ek merk dat julle HTTPS gebruik vir die oorplasing van reeds gekripteerde lêers. Is dit nie onnodig nie?
333: Dit is. Ongelukkig neem meeste browsers aanstoot teen die skepping van onveilige konneksies vanuit 'n veilige bladsy, en wie kan hulle kwalik neem - hulle kan onmoontlik nie bewus wees van die feit dat daar reeds 'n ander enkripsie laag in werking is nie. Omrede HTTPS 'n teenoorgestelde effek op optrede het, laat ons jou toe om dit af te skakel op browsers wat dit toelaat (Internet Explorer doen nie) om die spoed van jou oorplasing te verbeter sonder om die konfidensialiteit of integriteit ban jou data bloot te stel. Jy sal 'n SSL waarskuwing sien verskyn met jou eerste lêer oorplasing in sommige browsers - in hierdie (en slegs in hierdie) geval, is dit veilig om dit te ignoreer
334: Watse enkripsie algoritmes gebruik MEGA intern?
335: Vir grootmaat oorplasings, AES-128 (ons glo dat die hoër CPU verbruik van AES-192 en AES-256 weeg swaarder as die teoretiese veiligheids voordeel, ten minste tot die geboorte van quantum rekenaars). Na-aflaai integriteit nasiening word gedoen deur 'n stuk variasie van CCM, wat minder effektief is as OCB, maar nie gehinder word deur patente nie.
336: Om gedeelde geheime tussen verbruikers te vestig en om lêers in jou inbox te plaas, RSA-2048 (die sleutel lengte is gekies as in die middel tussen "te onveilig" en "te stadig"). Alle enkripsie, dekripsie en sleutel generasie is geimplimenteer in Javascript, wat verkeer beperk tot 'n paar MB/s en veroorsaak noemenswaardige CPU las. Ons sien uit na die voorgestelde HTML5 WebCrypto API in alle vooraanstaande browsers, wat hierdie opeenhoping sal uitskakel.
337: Javascript se random nommer genereerder is volgemaak deur 'n muis/sleutelbord tydgedrewe RC4 entropie poel.

339: Ons berg jou lêers op minstens twee servers in verskillende data sentrums, indien beskikbaar.

344: Wanneer is dit nodig om op te gradeer na 'n Pro rekening?
345: 'n Pro rekening gee jou addisionele bergings spasie en extra bandwydte kwota waarvan ons outomaties trek wanneer ookal operasionele bandwydte limiet bereik is - jy kan die kwota self gebruik of jy kan dit bied aan derde partye wat toegang het tot jou data (dit sluit verbruikers sonder 'n MEGA rekening in). Die maximum persentasie van jou bandwydte kwota wat geallokeer is aan derde partye is verstelbaar in jou rekening verstellings.
346: Hoekom is daar 'n opsie om my oplaai spoed te beperk, en hoekom is by verstek geaktiveer?
347: Baie routers prioritiseer kleiner pakkies in geval van skakel opeenhoping, wat jou inkomende verkeer erg beinvloed wanneer jou uitgaande skakel vol is. Daarom meet ons jou beskikbare uitgaande bandwydte gedurende die eerste tien sekondes van 'n oplaai en hou dan 10% daarvan ongebruik. Jy kan probeer om jou oplaai werksverrigting te maksimeer deur hierdie funksie te af te skakel.
348: Wat kry ek met my gratis rekening?

361: Ja, die oop-bron Javascript kode wat die browser gebaseerde Mega koppelvlak implimenteer gebruik ons API, so jy het 'n rykdom van werklike wêreld voorbeeld kode om uit te kies as jy ons [A]dokumentasie[/A] onvoldoende vind. Aangesien ons nie al die hulpbronne het om al die koel apps te bou wat MEGA in 'n veelsydige, nuttige hulpmiddel omskakel nie, nooi ons jou uit om ons te help. Nadat ons jou app ge-oudit het vir agterdeure, sal ons dit op ons werf ten toon stel. Ons bespreek graag inkomste verdeelings modelle vir hoogs populêre apps.
362: Om te voorkom dat ons bronne oorlaai word, het ons soms nodig om bandwydte gebruik te beperk. Die lêer wat jy wil aflaai is groter as ons huidige limiet van [X]. Die oorplasing is uitgestel en sal outomaties begin sodra die opeenhoping verlig.
365: Jou browser is te oud 'n lêer van hierdie grootte af te laai.
367: MEGA respekteer die kopiereg van ander en vereis dat gebruikers van die MEGA cloud diens die kopiereg wette sal nakom. 679: Alle lêers wat op MEGA geberg word, word geïnkripteer. Alle data oorplasings van en na MEGA word geïnkripteer. 1821: Toe ons MEGA vroeg in 2013 van stapel gestuur het, was globale massa afluistering onder die voorwendsel van terrorisme bevegting steeds 'n wilde veronderstelling en die wat dit voorgestel het is gereeld uitgekryt as sameswering teoretici. Edward Snowdense openbarings 137 dae later het publieke houding fundamenteel verander en dit het pynlik duidelik geword dat sekuriteit deur beleid ("ons het toegang tot jou data, maar ons belowe om dit konfidensieel te hou en nie te misbruik nie") nie goed genoeg was nie. Enige iets minder as sekuriteit deur ontwerp/ ("ons kan nie toegang tot jou data bekom sonder dat jy dit agterkom nie"), waarvoor sterk eindpunt-tot-eindpunt enkripsie 'n noodsaaklike voorvereiste is, blyk nou vêr tekort te skiet.
1822: MEGA is ontwerp rondom die eenvoudige feit dat kriptografie, vir dit om aanvaar en gebruik te word, moet dit nie inmeng met bruikbaarheid nie. MEGA is ten volle toegangbaar sonder voorafgaande sagteware installasie en dit bly die enigste cloud bergings verskaffer met browser-gebaseerde hoë-werksverrigting eindpunt-tot-eindpunt enkripsie. Die enigste sigbare tekens van die kripto laag wat onder MEGA se vaandel werk is die entropie versameling gedurende aantekening, die hebrek aan 'n wagwoord herstel funksie en die novelle (en browser-spesifieke) manier waarop lêer oorplasings gedoen word. Vandag maak miljoene besigheids en persoonlike gebruikers staat op MEGA om veilig en betroubaar petabytes te berg en bedien en ons glo dat hierdie sukses die gevolg is van MEGA se lae versperring na 'n meer veilige cloud.
1823: Ons huur gedurig. As jy 'n uitstaande sagteware ingeneur is en jy wil by ons globale span aansluit, moet asb nie huiwer om jou CV aan te stuur na jobs@mega.co.nz nie.

Veranderings wat jy maak aan die een kant sal byne terselfdertyd aan die anderkant verskyn (binne perke van die skakel/sisteem se vertraging en die lêer oorplasing tye).
1828: Gaan na die [A] aflaai bladsy [/A] en volg die instruksies. Gedurende die installasie, sal jy gevra word om in te skryf of skep jou MEGA rekening en vir die opstel van die gidse om te herhaal (óf jou volle MEGA cloud skyf na 'n enkele plaaslike gids of spesifieke sub-gids in jou cloud skyf na die ooreenstemmende plaaslike gidse). Na die installasie voltooi is, sal MEGAsync outomaties begin. Onder Windows, sal jy 'n klikbare MEGA logo sien in die system tray terwyl die sync tool loop wat jou toegang gee tot 'n status pop en die verstellings bladsy.

2000: Hoewel dit mag lyk om te werk met die eerste oogopslag, raai ons daarteen aan, want FAT tyd stempel is tydsone afhanklik , wat daartoe lei dat al jou lêers weer gesynchroniseer word  twee keer 'n jaar as jy woon in 'n dagligbesparingstyd gebied. Ongelukkig, die volgende fundamentele ontwerp fout in die Windows API ontwerp maak dit moeilik om dinamies  te vergoed vir sulke veranderinge: "Wanneer dit dagligbesparingstyd is,  word die tyd opgespoor deur GetFileTime 'n uur af, want die cache is nie opgedateer wanneer jy begin het nie.  Wanneer jy die rekenaar oorbegin sorg die cache dat GetFileTime  korrek is. "Met ander woorde, doen jouself 'n guns en vermy FAT.

Hierdie subskripsie gee jou 500 GB storing spasie en 1000 GB bandwydte per maand. Subskripsies word outomaties hernu vir opeenvolgende subskripsie periodes van dieselfde tydperk en teen dieselfde prys as die oorspronklike periode gekies. Jy kan die outomatiese hernuwing van jou MEGA Pro subskripsie kanselleer nie later nie as 24 uur voor jou volgende betaling verskuldig is deur jou iTunes rekening verstellings bladsy. Om jou subskripsies te bestuur, druk net op die App Store ikoon op jou toestel, teken aan met jou Apple ID aan die onderkant van die bladsy (as jy nie alreeds so gedoen het nie) en druk dan op Sien ID. Jy sal na jou rekening bladsy geneem word waar jy kan afrol na Bestuur App Subskripsies. Van hier kan jy jou MEGA Pro subskripsie kies en jou geskeduleerde hernuwingsdatum sien, 'n ander subskripsie paket kies of stel die aan-af skakel na af om die outomaties hernuwing van jou subskripsie buite werking te stel.Diensterme:https://mega.co.nz/ios_terms.htmlPrivaatheids beleid:https://mega.co.nz/ios_privacy.html

5909: MacOS/UNIX filenames are case sensitive, Windows filenames are not. A folder containing both "ABC.TXT" and "abc.txt" can be synced to a UNIX machine without problems, but when synced to a Windows machine, only one of the two files will survive.MEGA imposes no restrictions on filenames - they can contain characters that are incompatible with the operating system, such as : or *. These will be rewritten as %xx on the local side and converted back to the original character when synced back. The Windows Explorer also has trouble with a number of seemingly innocuous file and folder names - "con.doc", for example, would not be accessible (to understand why, you have to be a geek or a veteran, or both). If you encounter such a situation, simply rename the file on the cloud side. Foreign characters in filenames are fully supported.MEGAsync supports fairly deep folder structures (MEGA itself is limited to a maximum of 63 levels) and very long pathnames (up to 32,000 characters under Windows). Unfortunately, most Windows software (including the Explorer) is unable to access files whose path is longer than 260 characters.

6295: Copyright -  is a legal concept, enacted by most governments, giving the creator of an original work exclusive rights to it, usually for a limited time. Generally, it is "the right to copy", but also gives the copyright holder the right to be credited for the work, to determine who may adapt the work to other forms, who may perform the work, who may financially benefit from it, and other related rights. It is a form of intellectual property (like the patent, the trademark, and the trade secret) applicable to any expressible form of an idea or information that is substantive and discrete.

6378: You can relate bandwidth to the width of a highway, which then has multiple lanes for cars, depending on the width of the highway = maximum channel capacity at any given time of performing an upload or a download. The speed (of downloads/uploads) can be related to the speed of the cars. That is dependent on the state and speed of your computer, software, OS and versions, browsers and versions and your ISP provider. With Mega, you can control the 'speed' of downloads or of uploads, depending on your priorities in 'My Account' - 'Transfer Settings'.
6379: MEGA Bandwidth = the total amount of data, typically measured in MegaBytes or GigaBytes, that may be downloaded or uploaded from a particular web site or web hosting account during a given month. It is a frequency of a network connection between a local and a remote system (the remote system being your ISP), and your speed cannot exceed that of the frequency without changing the frequency (which is actually not changing the frequency, per se, but the wavelength).

6443: All files stored on MEGA are encrypted. All data transfers from and to MEGA are encrypted. And while most cloud storage providers can and do claim the same, MEGA is different – unlike the industry norm where the cloud storage provider holds the decryption key, with MEGA, you control the encryption, you hold the keys, and you decide who you grant or deny access to your files, without requiring any risky software installs. It’s all happening in your web browser!
6444: All our encryption is end-to-end. Data uploaded is encrypted on the uploading device before it is sent out to the Internet, and data downloaded is decrypted only after it has arrived on the downloading device. The client machines are responsible for generating, exchanging and managing the encryption keys. No usable encryption keys ever leave the client computers (with the exception of RSA public keys).
6445: The nominated and confirmed password for your MEGA account is also your unique master encryption key to your files. You could have noticed this being created upon your 'confirmation email' validation. The encryption key gets created from your password and to strengthen the key we have collected the entropy from your mouse movements and key stroke timings.
6446: Remember to keep your MEGA password secure and confidential at all times and generate your MASTER CRYPTO KEY for the event of misplacing your password in the future - https://mega.nz/#backup.
6447: No. Only file data and file/folder names are encrypted. Information that we need operational access to, such as your e-mail address, IP address, folder structure, file ownership and payment credentials, are stored and processed unencrypted. Please see our privacy policy for details.
6449: We make no use of the data a user stores with us because we cannot even decrypt it. MEGA uses a unique system of User Controlled Encryption. BEFORE your data leaves your browser, the file is encrypted (scrambled, unreadable) and then it leaves your computer, to be stored on the cloud as unreadable. The only way to decrypt/ make it readable is to download it back, while logged in to your file manager. Only when it reaches your browser, and realizes you are logged in with the correct credentials, does it begin decrypting (become readable). The only way to get the file is to be correctly logged into that account. This is UCE.
6450: Server controlled encryption (other storage providers) means the file is still readable when it is sent to the cloud, and then it is encrypted. When downloading, it is decrypted at the cloud, and then sent back to you fully readable. Not hard for prying eyes to see what is going on!

6459: All security is relative. The following attack vectors exist - they are not specific to MEGA, but we want you to know about the risks:
6461: - Spyware on your computer. A simple keylogger is enough, but session credentials and keys could also be extracted from memory or the filesystem.
6462: - Shoulder surfing. Do not type your password while someone could watch your keystrokes.
6464: - Phishing. Always confirm the security status of your connection (https://) and the correct domain name (mega.co.nz) before entering your password.
6465: Large-scale attacks could be mounted through:
6466: - A "man in the middle" attack. Requires issuing a valid duplicate SSL certificate in combination with DNS forging and/or attacks on our BGP routes (a DigiNotar-style scenario).
6467: - Gaining access to the webservers hosting https://mega.co.nz/index.html and replacing that file with a forged version (this would not affect access through the installed app base). Note that manipulating content on our distributed static content CDN does not pose a security risk, as all active content loaded from index.html is subject to verification with a cryptographic hash (think of it as some kind of "secure boot" for websites). This type of attack requires sending malicious code to the client and is therefore detectable.
6468: For bulk transfers, AES-128 (we believe that the higher CPU utilization of AES-192 and AES-256 outweighs the theoretical security benefit, at least until the advent of quantum computers). Post-download integrity checking is done through a chunked variation of CCM, which is less efficient than OCB, but not encumbered by patents.
6469: For establishing shared secrets between users and dropping files into your inbox, RSA-2048 (the key length was chosen as middle grounds between "too insecure" and "too slow"). All encryption, decryption and key generation is implemented in JavaScript, which limits throughput to a few MB/s and causes significant CPU load. We are looking forward to the implementation of the proposed HTML5 WebCrypto API in all major browsers, which will eliminate this bottleneck.
6470: There is no need to worry. Anything we do send through RC4 is already encrypted from the point it leaves your browser so there is no security risk. For increased security make sure you have our browser extensions installed. MEGA's users get to enjoy the privacy of their data with our User Controlled Encryption (UCE) mechanism - the only storage provider on the market offering this level of security and privacy.
6471: We are now conducting a single node tests to see in how much the server load will increase when using AES instead of RC4 so we can provide an alternative to those who have turned off RC4.
6472: For our customer's sake, some things are really important to us. One of these things is obviously security, whereas another one is performance. However, the former cannot be trumped by the latter!!!
6473: When you log in, receive the `secureboot.js` file, or when you're connecting to our API, you will *always* be running through a properly configured web server, which will give you strong authentication, strong encryption, as well as forward secrecy (PFS). These are the places where it matters that information is transferred in a secure fashion when using SSL/TLS!
6474: Afterwards, when you're accessing further static content, or when you're accessing your file storage, the client side (that is for example the JavaScript code in your browser, a browser extension, a
6475: sync client or a mobile app) will take care of ensuring security. Every content further loaded off of servers (e. g. the *.static.mega.co.nz servers) will be verified cryptographically by the client, and the content that could be seen on the wire is harmless. Every time data is transferred to or from our storage servers, the client side code will take care of proper, strong encryption, so that only ever the client alone is able to get access to the actual plain data.
6476: Given these circumstances, we could actually serve all static content and/or data transfers with our storage servers over a completely unencrypted connection. There would be *no* lack in security!
6477: However, browsers will refuse to allow for unencrypted HTTP connections (for good reasons) when originating from an HTTPS encrypted site, or they will at least display a degradation in security in the browser bar. This is all very good and common practice, especially if SSL/TLS is your line of defence when transmitting plain text data. For those reasons also, all subsequent connections generally should be of similar good strength in protection. However, as stated above, we don't actually need an encrypted HTTPS connection to uphold our protection (as we've taken care to completely encrypt the actual content already). But, we can't remove SSL/TLS (HTTPS) completely, as that would make the look in the browser "unhappy". Therefore, we have opted to use the weakest
6478: possible protection (RC4 with MD5) as a "NULL cipher" to prevent the browser from alarming people, whereas we would even be happy with an unencrypted connection altogether. This will give the end user an enhanced performance, *without* decreasing any security. And this is actually what our other clients are doing, they're getting rid of even RC4/MD5, but use strong SSL/TLS where needed.
6479: I hope this rather lengthy description has cleared up the situation, and lets you enjoy MEGA without a stale feeling of insecurity or security by hand waving. We really do take it seriously, and have put *lots* of thoughts into it.

6538: MacOS/UNIX filenames are case sensitive, Windows filenames are not. A folder containing both "ABC.TXT" and "abc.txt" can be synced to a UNIX machine without problems, but when synced to a Windows machine, only one of the two files will survive.
6539: MEGA imposes no restrictions on filenames - they can contain characters that are incompatible with the operating system, such as : or *. These will be rewritten as %xx on the local side and converted back to the original character when synced back. The Windows Explorer also has trouble with a number of seemingly innocuous file and folder names - "con.doc", for example, would not be accessible (to understand why, you have to be a geek or a veteran, or both). If you encounter such a situation, simply rename the file on the cloud side. Foreign characters in filenames are fully supported.

6555: This means however it will also synchronise mistakes made in your local folder, for example, if you accidentally overwrite a file in your local folder, that file will be updated in your MEGA account, hence it shouldn't be relied upon to backup live data.

6568: We provide for user controlled encryption (UCE) where you, the user, control the keys. The UCE implementation is open source, and we invite and encourage the community to scrutinise it and provide feedback.
6569: We believe that this approach is much safer than storing your data on a provider with server-side encryption where the ISP controls the keys or, worse, no encryption at all - if, for example, MEGA user files were suddenly accessible without a password due to a programming error, they would be unreadable without the user-controlled decryption keys.

6682: The privacy and security you get with browser based end to end encryption can take it's toll on speed as due to not all browsers provide complete HTML5 support. MEGA's users get to enjoy the privacy of their data with our User Controlled Encryption (UCE) mechanism - the only storage provider on the market offering this level of security and privacy.
6683: The speed of downloads/uploads is dependent on the state and speed of your computer, software, operating systems and versions and your ISP provider. With Mega, you can control the 'speed' of downloads or uploads, depending on your priorities in 'My Account' - 'Transfer Settings'. You can try to maximize your upload performance by disabling the 'Upload Speed Limit' as well.
6684: We do default the 'Upload Speed Limit' to enabled as many routers do not prioritize smaller packets in case of link congestion, resulting in your inbound traffic being severely affected when your outbound link is full. We therefore measure your available outbound bandwidth during the initial ten seconds of an upload and then keep at least 10% of it unused.
6685: The speed tests such as speedtest.net are great when you want to determine if your router or ISP has issues – you know what your speed ‘should’ be and this test indicates if there is an issue somewhere along the ‘lines’. However the result from speed test does not have a direct relation to speed with MEGA. The speed test will indicate whether everything is working right from the users or ISP’s end however there are other factors to take into consideration. Such as international peering issues (internet as a whole is currently experiencing: http://www.internetpulse.com/); the state of users computer (whether your software is up to date, whether your HDD and browser are clogged by temp or cached data or fragmented…); transfer speed also depends which server we are storing the data on.
6686: To sum it up - your Pro account's increased bandwidth does not have any relation to 'speed' however greater bandwidth may improve the speed of your traffic indirectly.
